means: at ：表地点时，指空间位置上的某一点；表时间时，指在时间上的某一时刻。
in ：表地点时，指在某一立体空间范围内；表时间时，指一段时间或与年、月、季节时间连用。
on ：表地点时，指某物与另一物表面相接触，或与某地方接壤等；表时间时，指在某一天或某一天的某个时间，尤指在星期几。

entry.def: You use at to indicate the place or event where something happens or is situated.

example.ex: We had dinner at a restaurant in Attleborough...
example.tran: 我们在阿特尔伯勒的一家餐厅里吃的饭。

example.ex: He will be at the airport to meet her...
example.tran: 他将去机场接她。

entry.def: If someone is at school or college, or at a particular school or college, they go there regularly to study.

example.ex: He was shy and nervous as a boy, and unhappy at school...
example.tran: 他小时候既害羞又胆怯，在学校过得并不快乐。

example.ex: It was at university that he first encountered Hopkins...
example.tran: 他第一次遇见霍普金斯是在上大学的时候。

entry.def: If you are at something such as a table, a door, or someone's side, you are next to it or them.

example.ex: An assistant sat typing away at a table beside him...
example.tran: 助手坐在他身旁的一张桌子上埋头打字。

example.ex: Graham was already at the door...
example.tran: 格雷厄姆已经在门口了。

entry.def: When you are describing where someone or something is, you can say that they are at a certain distance. You can also say that one thing is at an angle in relation to another thing.
entry.tran: 从相隔（一段距离）的地方;呈…角度

example.ex: The two journalists followed at a discreet distance...
example.tran: 那两个记者谨慎地保持距离跟在后面。

example.ex: The tree was leaning at a low angle from the ground.
example.tran: 那棵树倾斜得非常厉害。

entry.def: If something happens at a particular time, that is the time when it happens or begins to happen.

example.ex: The funeral will be carried out this afternoon at 3.00...
example.tran: 葬礼将在今天下午3点举行。

example.ex: He only sees her at Christmas and Easter.
example.tran: 他只有在圣诞节和复活节时才能见到她。

entry.def: If you do something at a particular age, you do it when you are that age.

example.ex: Blake emigrated to Australia with his family at 13...
example.tran: 布莱克在13岁时随家人移民到了澳大利亚。

example.ex: Mary Martin has died at her home in California at the age of seventy-six.
example.tran: 玛丽·马丁76岁时卒于加利福尼亚家中。

entry.def: You use at to express a rate, frequency, level, or price.
entry.tran: 以，达（某一速度、频率、水平或价格）

example.ex: I drove back down the highway at normal speed...
example.tran: 我以正常车速沿公路返回。

example.ex: Check the oil at regular intervals, and have the car serviced regularly...
example.tran: 定期检查汽油，并对车辆进行定期维护。

entry.def: You use at before a number or amount to indicate a measurement.

example.ex: Weighing in at eighty tons, the B-19 was easily the largest and most sophisticated warplane in the world.
example.tran: B-19重达80吨，无疑是世界上最大、最先进的军用飞机。

example.ex: ...as unemployment stays pegged at three million.
example.tran: 当失业人数维持在300万

entry.def: If you look at someone or something, you look towards them. If you direct an object or a comment at someone, you direct it towards them.
entry.tran: 朝（某人或某物看）；向（某人掷物）；冲（某人说话）

example.ex: He looked at Michael and laughed...
example.tran: 他看着迈克尔笑了。

example.ex: The crowds became violent and threw petrol bombs at the police...
example.tran: 人群变得狂暴起来，并向警察投掷汽油弹。

entry.def: You can use at after verbs such as 'smile' or 'wave' and before nouns referring to people to indicate that you have put on an expression or made a gesture which someone is meant to see or understand.

example.ex: She opened the door and stood there, frowning at me...
example.tran: 她打开门站在那里，朝我皱着眉头。

example.ex: We waved at the staff to try to get the bill.
example.tran: 我们向工作人员招了招手，想要买单。

entry.def: If you point or gesture at something, you move your arm or head in its direction so that it will be noticed by someone you are with.

example.ex: He pointed at the empty bottle and the waitress quickly replaced it...
example.tran: 他指了指空瓶子，女服务员立即重新拿了一瓶。

example.ex: He gestured at the shelves. 'I've bought many books from him.'
example.tran: 他指着书架说，“我已经从他那里买了不少书了”。

entry.def: If you are working at something, you are dealing with it. If you are aiming at something, you are trying to achieve it.
entry.tran: 致力于;定位于;期望达到

example.ex: She has worked hard at her marriage.
example.tran: 她努力维系着她的婚姻。

example.ex: ...a $1.04m grant aimed at improving student performance on placement examinations.
example.tran: 旨在提高学生编班考试成绩的104万美元拨款

entry.def: If something is done at someone's invitation or request, it is done as a result of it.

example.ex: She left the light on in the bathroom at his request...
example.tran: 她按照他的要求将浴室里的灯开着。

example.ex: I visited Japan in 1987 at the invitation of the Foreign Minister.
example.tran: 应日本外相的邀请，我于1987年访问了日本。

entry.def: You use at to say that someone or something is in a particular state or condition.

example.ex: I am afraid we are not at liberty to disclose that information...
example.tran: 恐怕我们无权透露这一信息。

example.ex: Their countries had been at war for nearly six weeks.
example.tran: 他们的国家陷入战争状态已将近6个星期了。

entry.def: You use at before a possessive pronoun and a superlative adjective to say that someone or something has more of a particular quality than at any other time.
entry.tran: （用于所有格代词和形容词最高级前，表示某人或某物在此时的某一特征最鲜明）

example.ex: He was at his happiest whilst playing cricket...
example.tran: 玩板球时他最开心了。

example.ex: Howards End is old fashioned film-making at its best.
example.tran: 《霍华德庄园》是一部经典的老派电影。

entry.def: You use at to say how something is being done.

example.ex: Three people were killed by shots fired at random from a minibus...
example.tran: 3个人被从一辆面包车中发射的乱弹打死了。

example.ex: Mr Martin was taken out of his car at gunpoint.
example.tran: 马丁先生被人用枪指着从车里带了出来。

entry.def: You use at to show that someone is doing something repeatedly.

example.ex: She lowered the handkerchief which she had kept dabbing at her eyes...
example.tran: 她放下了那块一直用来擦眼睛的手帕。

example.ex: Miss Melville took a cookie and nibbled at it.
example.tran: 梅尔维尔小姐拿起一块饼干小口吃起来。

entry.def: You use at to indicate an activity or task when saying how well someone does it.

example.ex: I'm good at my work...
example.tran: 我对自己的工作得心应手。

example.ex: Robin is an expert at cheesemaking...
example.tran: 罗宾是奶酪制作专家。

entry.def: You use at to indicate what someone is reacting to.

example.ex: Eleanor was annoyed at having had to wait so long for him...
example.tran: 埃莉诺为不得不等他这么长时间而感到很恼火。

example.ex: The British team did not disguise their delight at their success...
example.tran: 英国队毫不掩饰他们获胜的喜悦。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  æt, of Germanic origin; related to Old Frisian et and Old Norse at, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin ad 'to'
